description: Versatile hand techniques using various striking surfaces beyond the fist for specialized attacks and applications.

focusAreas: Proper striking surface formation and alignment
Body mechanics for different strike types
safety: Use controlled force when training strikes
Focus on proper surface formation to prevent injury
Build flexibility for specialized strikes gradually
Use appropriate targets for each strike type

techniques.description: Strike using outside blade of hand in outward motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A fundamental strike using the outside blade of the hand (from little finger to wrist) in an outward swinging motion.
techniques.application: Attacking neck, temple, or floating ribs. Effective against multiple opponents.
steps: Form proper knife hand with fingers extended together
Swing arm in outward circular motion
Strike with outside blade of hand
Use hip rotation to enhance power
Retract quickly to defensive position
commonMistakes: Striking with wrong part of hand

techniques.description: Sideways strike using knife hand in horizontal motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A horizontal strike using the knife hand, delivered sideways to target areas like neck, ribs, or arms.
techniques.application: Close-range attacks, striking vulnerable side areas, and combination techniques.
steps: Form knife hand with proper alignment
Execute horizontal striking motion
Strike with knife hand blade
Maintain proper distance for horizontal impact
Retract along same horizontal path
commonMistakes: Striking with palm instead of blade

techniques.description: Strike using back of fist in snapping motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A quick, snapping strike using the back of the fist, typically targeting head, face, or sensitive areas.
techniques.application: Fast, surprising attacks, combination setups, and close-range striking.
steps: Form loose fist with back knuckles as striking surface
Execute quick snapping motion from elbow
Strike with back of fist knuckles
Use wrist snap for additional speed
Retract immediately after contact
commonMistakes: Striking with wrong part of fist

techniques.description: Knife hand strike delivered in inward circular motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A circular strike using the knife hand in inward motion, targeting neck, head, or floating ribs from outside-in.
techniques.application: Circular attacks around guards, striking from angles, and combination sequences.
steps: Form knife hand with proper alignment
Execute inward circular motion
Strike with inside blade of hand
Use full circular momentum for power
Follow through and retract
commonMistakes: Striking with palm instead of blade

techniques.description: Powerful strike using front of elbow in forward motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A close-range striking technique using the point of the elbow in forward thrusting motion, generating tremendous power.
techniques.application: Close-quarters combat, grappling situations, and powerful breaking techniques.
steps: Bend elbow to 90-degree angle
Thrust elbow forward with body weight
Strike with point of elbow
Use hip rotation for maximum power
Recover to guarding position

techniques.description: Upward elbow strike targeting chin or solar plexus from below
techniques.detailedDescription: An upward-directed elbow strike starting from low position and rising to target, using the elbow point as weapon.
techniques.application: Close-range uppercut-like attacks, striking under guards, and countering against grabs.
steps: Start from low position with elbow bent
Drive elbow upward in rising motion
Strike with elbow point to target
Use leg power to enhance upward force
Return to defensive position

techniques.description: Sideways strike using back fist in horizontal motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A horizontal back fist strike delivered sideways, combining speed of back fist with power of horizontal motion.
techniques.application: Quick side attacks, combination techniques, and striking multiple opponents.
steps: Form back fist striking surface
Execute horizontal swinging motion
Strike with back of fist knuckles
Use body rotation for power
Retract quickly to avoid counter

techniques.description: Master-level strike delivered downward with various hand formations
techniques.detailedDescription: An advanced striking technique delivered in downward motion, using appropriate hand formation for specific downward targets.
techniques.application: Breaking techniques, striking down on opponents, and demonstrating master-level striking power.
steps: Assume proper position for downward force
Execute powerful downward striking motion
Strike with appropriate hand formation
Use body weight to enhance downward power
Recover with complete control
commonMistakes: Poor hand formation for downward strike
